identificationModule.briefTitle: Curing Atrial Fibrillation in Heart Failure
identificationModule.officialTitle: Radiofrequency Ablation for Atrial Fibrillation in Advanced Chronic Heart Failure

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Heart failure is a condition that occurs when the heart muscle weakens and no longer contracts normally. Half of these patients have an irregularity of heart rhythm called atrial fibrillation (AF). Patients with both heart failure and AF spend more time in hospital, and die earlier than those with heart failure alone. AF is difficult to treat with conventional methods in patients with heart failure. Radiofrequency ablation is a new technique used to cure AF. The investigators aim to establish if radiofrequency ablation for atrial fibrillation in patients with advanced heart failure can result in marked improvement in the function of the heart.

armGroups.label: medical therapy
armGroups.description: Standard therapy for heart failure with angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors(ACE) - (Ramipril, enalapril, lisinopril, captopril, perindopril), beta-blocker (BB) - (carvedilol, bisoprolol, metoprolol), Aldosterone antagonists (spironolactone) +/- diuretics and digoxin
interventionNames: Drug: ACE inhibitor - ramipril, enalapril, captopril, perindopril, lisinopril
Drug: Beta Blocker (BB) - metoprolol, bisoprolol, carvedilol

armGroups.label: Radiofrequency ablation (RFA)
armGroups.description: Isolation of the pulmonary veins using radiofrequency ablation

interventions.name: radiofrequency ablation
interventions.description: isolation of the pulmonary veins with radiofrequency ablation (RFA)

interventions.name: ACE inhibitor - ramipril, enalapril, captopril, perindopril, lisinopril
interventions.description: Evidence based treatment for heart failure. Dose and type will depend on patient tolerability.

interventions.name: Beta Blocker (BB) - metoprolol, bisoprolol, carvedilol
interventions.description: Evidence based treatment for heart failure. Dose and type will depend on patient tolerance.

interventions.name: Aldosterone Antagonists - spironolactone
interventions.description: Evidence based treatment for heart failure. Dose and type will depend on patient to treatment.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction by Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI)%
primaryOutcomes.description: left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) is a measure of the % of blood ejected from the ventricle in one heart beat. It is a measure of cardiac function. We measured LVEF at baseline and at 6 months, to assess whether there had been a change in the patients cardiac function over time.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Baseline Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction by Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI)
primaryOutcomes.description: Baseline Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction by Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI)in %

primaryOutcomes.measure: Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction by Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI)at 6 Months
primaryOutcomes.description: Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction as measured by Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI)at 6 months

secondaryOutcomes.description: venous blood taken to assess levels of the above peptide. High evels of the peptide are associated with adverse prognosis. Blood levels are taken at baseline and 6 months. The change over 6 months is assessed, thereore it is possible to have a negative number if the level falls.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Plasma B-type Natriuretic Peptide (BNP) at Baseline
secondaryOutcomes.description: Plasma B-type Natriuretic Peptide (BNP) measured at basline

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Plasma B-type Natriuretic Peptide (BNP) at 6 Months

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Informed consent
* Persistent atrial fibrillation (AF)
* New York Heart Association (NYHA) II, III and IV chronic heart failure (CHF) despite optimal medical therapy for at least 3 months
* left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) \<35% - as measured by radionuclide ventriculography (RNVG)
* Patients with CHF secondary to ischaemic and non-ischaemic aetiology

Exclusion Criteria:

* QRS duration \>150ms (or QRS 120-150 with evidence of mechanical cardiac dysynchrony)
* Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) - incompatible metallic (ferrous) prosthesis
* Primary valvular disease as a cause of CHF
* Reversible causes of CHF
* Acute myocarditis
* Patients aged 18 or less
* Patients having undergone revascularisation procedures within 6 months
* Paroxysmal AF
* Pregnancy
* Expected cardiac transplantation within 6 months

references.citation: MacDonald MR, Connelly DT, Hawkins NM, Steedman T, Payne J, Shaw M, Denvir M, Bhagra S, Small S, Martin W, McMurray JJ, Petrie MC. Radiofrequency ablation for persistent atrial fibrillation in patients with advanced heart failure and severe left ventricular systolic dysfunction: a randomised controlled trial. Heart. 2011 May;97(9):740-7. doi: 10.1136/hrt.2010.207340. Epub 2010 Nov 4.

groups.title: Medical Therapy
groups.description: This consisted of standard treatment of heart failure as per international guidelines. Treatment generally included use of ace-inhibitors (captopril, enalapril, lisinopril, perindopril, ramipril), beta blocker (metoprolol, carvedilol, bisoprolol) and aldosterone antagonists (spironolactone). Obviously actual combination dose and type of drug used dependent on patient comorbidity and tolerance.

groups.title: Radiofrequency Ablation
groups.description: Patients underwent isolation of the pulmonary veins with radiofrequency ablation. This was performed a maximum of 2 times to try to acheive sinus rhythm. All patients also received background heart failure treatment as per international guidelines.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction by Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI)%
outcomeMeasures.description: left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) is a measure of the % of blood ejected from the ventricle in one heart beat. It is a measure of cardiac function. We measured LVEF at baseline and at 6 months, to assess whether there had been a change in the patients cardiac function over time.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Number of patients analyzed is different from number of patients enrolled because some of the outcomes could not be measured in some patients ie the patient did not tolerate an mri or dropped out of the study
outcomeMeasures.unitOfMeasure: percentage of blood ejected in one beat
